page.title: 09DAIRY FARMING IN THORNSETT
page.content: The farmer showed us a milking parlour where he milks ten cows at a time.The milk goes straight into glass containers through pipes.The cows are milked early in the morning and at half past seven at night.The cows are fed during milking to keep them happy.The tanker comes at twelve o'clock to collect a tanker full of milk.The farm has a lot of warm pens called winter pens and a large barn where silage is stored for feeding the cows in winter. A lot of machinery is kept in another barn- a small combine harvester,potato planter,two tractors, a plough and lots of others.There was also a cow which had a lame leg so it had a stable of its own in the corner.There were seventy cows on the farm,all fresians.Some of their calves were brown and white because the dad was a hereford bull.
